intro: Senecio delphiniphyllus, commonly known as the Delphinium-leaved Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of delphiniums, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Senecio delphiniphyllus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
